did.unittitle: American Association of University Women. Durham Branch (N.C.) records 1913-1976 and undated
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: The Durham, N.C. branch of the American Association of University Women was founded in 1913. The records of the AAUW Durham chapter span the years from its founding in 1913 through the 1960s. The central organizational records are almost complete for this period, including minutes of Executive Board meetings, Presidents' files, financial records, membership information, and national and state convention files. The Presidents' files contain chiefly correspondence, but programs, membership rosters, and leadership information are also present. Records are arranged alphabetically by file groups.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The American Association of University Women. Durham Branch (N.C.) Records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1967 and 1977.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Encoded by Ted Holt and Paula Jeannet Mangiafico, Nov. 2009

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Durham, N.C. branch of the American Association of University Women was founded in 1913.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Association of Collegiate Alumnae formed in 1881; the Southern Association of College Women formed in 1903. They merged in 1921 to become the American Association of University Women. The Durham branch was founded in 1913 and became part of the AAUW at its founding in 1921. The records of the AAUW Durham chapter span the years from its founding in 1913 through the 1960s. The central organizational records are almost complete for this period, including minutes of Executive Board meetings, Presidents' files, financial records, membership information, and national and state convention files. The Presidents' files contain chiefly correspondence, but programs, membership rosters, and leadership information are also present. Records are arranged alphabetically by file groups.

did.unittitle: Association of University Women. Durham Branch (N.C.) Records, 1913-1976 and undated
Unorganized records: history of Durham branch, constitution, by-laws, minutes, newsletters, budget information, some undated

scopecontent.p: Files contain meeting minutes (1966-1973); notes on the history of the Durham branch; subject files on education, international relations, other branches of the AAUW; bylaws, membership, and fellowship information; a handbook for AAUW leadership; and financial records.
